H0.text: What Gaelic word which means 'bad ale' is given to an unlicensed Irish drinking house. Sheiling

H1.text: What Gaelic word which means 'bad ale' is given to an unlicensed Irish drinking house. Bothan

H2.text: What Gaelic word which means 'bad ale' is given to an unlicensed Irish drinking house. Céilidh

H3.text: What Gaelic word which means 'bad ale' is given to an unlicensed Irish drinking house. Shibeen

A4.text: The term shebeen derives from the Irish síbín, meaning 'illicit whiskey' and was first used as far back as the late 1700s.

A5.text: In Newfoundland, the term shebeen is defined as an 'unlicensed place where illicit liquor is sold.'
